message.content:
<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: String currentString = "Fruit: they taste good";
StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(currentString, ":");
String firstString = st.nextToken().trim(); // "Fruit"
String secondString = st.nextToken().trim(); // "they taste good"

TextView textView1 = (TextView) findViewById(R.id.text_view1);
TextView textView2 = (TextView) findViewById(R.id.text_view2);

textView1.setText(firstString);
textView2.setText(secondString);
<<<explanation>>>: The StringTokenizer class is used to split the string into tokens. In this case, the delimiter is ":". The nextToken() method is used to get the next token from the StringTokenizer object. The trim() method is used to remove leading and trailing spaces. The setText() method is used to set the text of the TextViews.
